IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: Education institue of higher learning offering accredited bachelors , masters and doctoral programs.
IRS990.MissionDescription: Union Institute & University empowers adults to acquire, apply and create knowledge through interdisciplinary, flexible and collaborative programs focusing on social relevance, personal enrichment, and professional advancement.
IRS990.Description: Higher Education: Academic services and instruction to students in accredited BA, BS, Masters and Doctoral programs.

OtherLiabilities.Description: Advances from Fed Gov't for student loans

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: The University has adopted investment and spending policies for endowment assets with the objectives of preservation of both the principal and fund purchasing power. The spending policies conform to the purpose and intent of each endowment.

At the current time the University does not have any taxable income. In the event this changes in the future, the University will implement the reporting in accordance with FASB Interpretation No 48 (FIN 48).

IRS990ScheduleE.PubViaBroadcastMediaExpln: The organization's non-discrimination policy is available on the university's website.
IRS990ScheduleE.GovtFinancialAidExplanation: The organization qualifies for Title IV funds and also receives funds from state grant agencies.

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: Federal and state grants are awarded based on Federal Title IV and state higher educational compliance requirements. Institutional Scholarships are awarded based upon parameters that are monitored by the University's financial aid department. Endowment scholarship's are awarded within parameters established by each endowment fund and are monitored by a university scholarship committee.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: Housing allowance for Roger H Sublett of $40,000 and treated as taxable compensation (Box 5, form W-2).
University contributes to a 457f and 457b plan on behalf of Roger H Sublett.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Process to review Form 990: The University's Form 990 is prepared by its internal accounting staff. It is reviewed by the University's CFO as well as by the members of the President's Cabinet. Copies are also provided to the Board of Trustees for their review and comments.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: An annual conflict of interest statement and disclosure form is required to be completed and signed by each trustee and key administrator. The form also requires updates for any changes in status that may occur throughout the year.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, Line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Compensation for Roger H. Sublett is determined by the Board of Trustees using a review of similar organizations' Form 990.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, Line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The University's Form 990 is available for inspection upon request. The University's conflict of interest policy is included as part of its human resource policy manual and is available to all employees on its intranet site. Financial statement information is included in the University's Annual Report that is mailed to its constituents.

ReasonableCauseExplanation.Explanation: Not applicable - Form 8868 was filed by mail and the extension was approved.
